Job Posting:168448 - Position: S25 Network Automation Developer Co-op/Intern 168448 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 04/18/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 04/04/2025 03:40 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Nokia Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Network Automation Developer Co-op/Intern 168448 Co-op Position Ottawa, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List $34,480 to $84,480 per year • Position: Job Title : Network Automation Developer Co-op/Intern • Number of Position(s): 1 • Duration: 4 months • Date: May 12th, 2025, to August 29th, 2025 Location: Hybrid in Ottawa, Canada • HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT YOU WILL LEARN As a part of our team, you will: • Learn about Fixed Access Networks and Automation • Participate in design and development of Automation Workflows • Test the Automation workflows on lab systems • Maintain and fix bugs in the code Learn about SDK for App development on the platform • About Us Come create the technology that helps the world act together Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people's lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work What we offer Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered. Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality: • One of the World's Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere • Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg Workplace Pride Global Benchmark • At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia's employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect. Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed. Job Requirements KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE • Proficiency in coding in Python, Java, Java Script, MySQL & C • Basic understanding of Fixed Access Networks • Knowledge of testing methodology • Experience working with Large Data sets and data visualization Ability to work independently • It would be nice if you also had: Experience with handling new technologies like AI/ML with a researcher attitude • Education Requirements Currently a candidate for Bachelor's in Computer Science at an accredited university in Canada. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: https://fa-evmr-saasfaprod1.fa.ocs.oraclecloud.com/hcmUI/CandidateExperience/en/sites/CX_1/job/18980 Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
